text: <@U0ULK2JPP> : We have skipped voting on behave verify and merge jobs but this applies to only success, failure and not built cases.
We don't have an option to skip vote on abort case ( We are forcibly aborting if build takes more than 120 mins).. I will check if there is any option to do this
<@U11HH3P7Y> sure, thanks much… I didn’t follow  _ build takes more than 120 mins_  - I thought it was behave that was taking long time ?
I could easily be wrong...
yes behave build is taking long time than usual
I see, thanks <@U11HH3P7Y>
<@U0ULK2JPP> <@U11HH3P7Y> usually the behave tests take no more than an hour or so… 2 hours is clearly indication of a problem
thanks <@U0KM61BCP>
behave tests need to be investigated then.
no problem indicated in the infrastructure itself… understood
well, build and unit tests take almost 3x on jenkins than my macbook... we might want to investigate that too
cbf: would more cores shorten the build time?
right now each VM has 4 cores

hi. i'm working  with <@U11HH3P7Y> to re-integrate the z builds into the overall build process.  currently, there is an issue with the building of the javaenv docker image for z ( and it also affects p ).  i opened up an issue FAB-358 about a week ago, and was wondering if anyone has been assigned to look at this issue.  i see that Srirama Sharma has posted a potential resolution to this issue.  hopefully, someone will be able to take ownership of this issue.  this will move the ball forward in reintegrating z builds back into the overall process.   FAB-358 url: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-358>
<@U0UHG4VP1> I don’t know my mbp has 2 and a whole build can be done in like 30 minutes including behave tests
<@U0UHG4VP1> the gerrit UI is confounding… why is it that the name search for adding reviewers sometimes works and sometimes not?
shouldn’t it basically find anyone?
cbf: I do not know. I usually end up adding them by email
<@U0UHG4VP1> annoying;-)
if I use the email, it finds the name
but the name is associated wit hthe email
yes, it is. that is one feature that seems to defy improvement, release to release
so it should find that
lol
the UX is almost as bad as Lotus Notes lol
hehe, well i am glad that there isn’t a greener pasture in the land the CI - seems like all the ecosystems are just barely “good enough” :slightly_smiling_face:
none are awesome in all ways
<@U0UHG4VP1>: Could you please add `Z build `machine (hyp-z-linuxone-2) to sandox.. I have to test thoroughly before enable in ci-pipeline
<@U11HH3P7Y> <https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/sandbox/computer/hyp-z-linuxone-2/>
Thanks <@U0UHG4VP1>
sure thing.
<@U0KPFAZNF> is it OK to merge <https://gerrit.hyperledger.org/r/#/c/1151/> with the “any time the word release is in the commit message a build will fire” setting?
looks
my gut says: we dont want that behavior.  However, my gut also says there’s likely to be a few iterations to get this correct and its not “production” yet anyway
so, in the interest of expediency to the iterative process, I say go for it
we can test/refine
once we can get this thing reliable and pushing out images, we can be more discretionary with niggles like that
if possible, please give me as much permission to tweak the resulting jobs as possible (minimally, kick off jobs, but also possibly settings, etc)
I realize we want to capture the setting in JJB, but it might be shorter iterations if I can experiment directly
that’s what the sandbox is for
if that poses problems, then no problem
I mean, that is literally the reason the sandbox exists
can we direct the JJB to the sandbox?
i thought the only limitation was I couldnt submit the jobs as JJB
if thats not the case, I agree
I sent you instructions on how to do that, I thought
oh, heh, you did, but it wasnt clear to me on how to use it
(mostly because I dont know how to write a JJB description
can we direct <@U11HH3P7Y>’s work to the sandbox?
that would be idea
you want me to revert the last merge?
ideal
no, I think its fine…nothing is relying on this pipeline yet except my own internal development
you should be able to generate the xml (and test it for validity) and push it to the sandbox at will
ok, that was the part that wasnt clear
i understand there is JJB description -> JJB tooling -> XML -> Jenkins
i was unclear what the submission interface was
i think I get you now
<@U0UHG4VP1>: any clue why the new jobs not added to Jenkins
if I read the docs correctly you grab an API token from Jenkins. I haven’t walked through it stepwise, so I need to do that
IIUC, for production we have ci-management.git -> gerrit -> JJB …..
but you can short circuit that in sandbox and run the JJB tooling yourself, and then submit the XML directly
<@U0UHG4VP1> yeah, i echo <@U11HH3P7Y> ’s question
where are the new jobs?
is there a lag>
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/>
Needed a new view
ghaskins I think you understand correctly. I have a meeting in 7, afterwards I will walk through it stepwise and make sure it works
i see them now, thx
that makes sense to have a new namespace
I could change the regex for the fabric tab as well.
<@U0UHG4VP1>: please install downstream-ext plugin <https://wiki.jenkins-ci.org/display/JENKINS/Downstream-Ext+Plugin>
<@U11HH3P7Y> looks like the baseimage pipeline in general is not working
<https://jenkins.hyperledger.org/view/fabric-baseimage/job/fabric-baseimage-merge-x86_64/1/console>
for some reason, its trying to do fabric-like stuff
looking into that..
i dont know enough about JJB to say way
why
so the baseimage jobs are waiting for builders that will never exist (they want a tag hyp-fabric-[‘x86_64’])
I canceled those waiting builds..
working on that issue
please use the sandbox from here out.
